text: ==Arts== ===Literature=== * Muhammad ibn Jarir al-Tabari (838-923), was a Persian world historian and theologian (the most famous and widely influential person called al-Tabari). * Espahbod Sa'ad ad-Din Varavini AN ABRIDGED TRANSLATION OF THE HISTORY OF ṬABARISTÁN BY MUHAMMAD B. AL-ḤASAN B. ISFANDIYÁR who wrote the book called Marzuban-nama, and also a Divan of poetry in the Ṭabarí dialect, known as the Níkí-nama. * Ibn Isfandiyar, historian, author of a history of Tabaristan (Tarikh-i Tabaristan). * Mírzá Asadu’llah Fádil Mázandarání (1880–1957), Iranian Bahá'í scholar. * Musa ibn Khalil Mazandarani, 19th century Persian scribe and scholar. * Sayyed Zahiruddin Mar'ashi * Parviz Natel-Khanlari ====Poetry==== Nima Youshij * Nima Youshij * Mohammad Zohari * Amir Pazevari * Mina Assadi * Seyed Karim Amiri Firuzkuhi * Mohsen Emadi ===Music=== Gholam Hossein Banan * Gholam Hossein Banan * Abdolhossein Mokhtabad * Delkash * Bijan Mortazavi * Mohammad Donyavi * Afshin * Benyamin Bahadori * Farhang Sharif * Parisa * Simin Ghanem * Majid Akhshabi ===Architecture=== * Omar Tiberiades (Abû Hafs 'Umar ibn al-Farrukhân al- Tabarî Amoli) (d.c.815), Persian astrologer and architect. ===Cinema=== Shahab Hosseini * Shahab Hosseini * Parinaz Izadyar * Roya Nonahali * Khosrow Ardalan Shoja Kaveh ===Portrait=== * Mokarrameh Ghanbari ===Scholar=== Manochehr Sotoudeh * Manouchehr Sotodeh * Mohammad Taqi Danesh Pajouh * Ahmad Ghahreman == History == *Arash *Maziar ==Science== ===Medicine, Biology and Chemistry=== * Ali ibn Sahl Rabban al- Tabari His stature, however, was eclipsed by his more famous pupil, Muhammad ibn Zakarīya Rāzi. * Abul Hasan al-Tabari, a 10th-century Iranian physician. ===Social sciences=== * Abu'l Tayyeb TabariEncyclopedia Iranica was jurisconsult, judge (qāżī), and professor of legal sciences; he was regarded by his contemporaries as one of the leading Shafeʿites of 5th/11th century Baghdad. ==New Science== * Ali Yachkaschi * Moslem Bahadori * Iraj Malekpour * Pooran Farrokhzad * Shahrokh Meskoob ==Philosophy== * Fakhr al-Din al-Razi
